website_summaries.verdict: The best bicycle seatpost to buy due to the various tube sizes that fit almost any bike.
pros: Comes in a variety of tube diameters for different bike styles and sizes
Tube is strong and durable for different riding styles such as BMX, road, and mountain biking
cons: Required Allen wrench is larger than most standard kit wrenches

customer_reviews.title: It breaks......
customer_reviews.text: Dangerous and NOT cool. Almost reanacted the exhaust manifold scene from Mask. The seller has issued a full refund. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: James S. Middleton

customer_reviews.title: Did King Kong tighten the bolt that holds the seat rails?
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy. Fit perfectly into the seat tube. I only road the bike about 200 feet to test the seat, so I can't speak to the post's longevity. So why the low rating? The bolt (mine was 6mm, not 8mm as others have said) that holds the seat rails was so tight I couldn't loosen it. And I have the long allen wrenches with handles that the bike shops use, and which allow a lot of force to be used. So how'd I loosen it? Since I don't have a vise, I put a put a pipe wrench around the seat post, another pipe wrench around the allen wrench handle, pretended I was the incredible hulk, and it barely worked.
customer_reviews.author: Chris DeFrancesco

customer_reviews.title: Great Seatpost (ALMOST)
customer_reviews.text: Great Seatpost (ALMOST). 27.2mm post hex bolt is ~9mm. There is no reason for this large of a size as 'Park', and other tools that serious bikers carry with them only go up to 6mm. (Supplier probably got a great price on ~9mm bolt as otherwise it does not make to need a rare hex wrench for bikes). From a former bike mechanic and racer this is the only flaw I see, but is one I find unexcusable. Now I either need to return, or buy a hex wrench size that I have never needed in 35+ years. Happy biking! :)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Richter

customer_reviews.title: Cansucc - it does
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for kids bike or commuter bike with rider under 150 lbs. Thinner walls, cheaper grade aluminum make this unsuitable for adult MTBs that see other than surface streets. I noted too much flex of the tube when I tried riding on it extended 200 mm. Not so with higher quality stems. Single bolt clamp design is a nice feature for this inexpensive stem, as are the markings on the stem to adjust height. The name logo is silly - Cansucc. Well, now I understand.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Better than what came on the bike.
customer_reviews.text: I put this on a Nishiki Colorado mountain bike that I bought at Dicks sporting goods. The one that came with the bike was probably good enough, but due to the inadequate abilities of the staff of Dicks to put bikes together properly it didn't last long. I installed this seat post myself and expect that it will last the life of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Jack of All

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as expected.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second post. I just bought one for my daughter's bike. It installed well and fit my aftermarket saddle perfectly for both bikes. The angle adjustment is simple and there is no wiggle. My rides are usually 15 - 35 miles and I've used this for a few years since my previous post and seat were stolen. (NY cyclist right of passage). They are a sturdy as the day I purchased them. The outdoors haven't seemed to scratch up the finish so the appearance is the same as it's been for a few years.
customer_reviews.author: Tony J

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: Owned the Seatpost for almost a year, but I don't ride the bike in Indiana winters, maybe 6 months of use. Started changing the saddle out for a new saddle, something didn't look right. Dissasembled the saddle mounting bracket and found a crack in the bottom mounting bracket. The warranty period has expired, have to purchase a new post. Never seen that before.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit the Giant mountainbike well
customer_reviews.text: The size ordered is the largest one, 30.8 mm, but it seems a bit small for my bike. I've installed it without an issue, locked it in place and the seat got lower as the post kept sliding in. I really had to tighten up the lock screw to stop the post sliding in. Maybe it's just the Giants bike, where it is not the right size.
customer_reviews.author: Pannon

customer_reviews.title: Can't unscrew the clamp!
customer_reviews.text: Was using a 6mm hex key.. could NOT get the screw to budge ANY amount. I have a full set of imperial and metric hex keys, none of them fit 100%, though 6mm was very close. I've seen multiple reviewers talk about a 8mm, they must have updated the screw size because that's way too big for this screw. I'd recommend not wasting your time with this particular product. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: likes
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an experts when it comes to bicycles and bicycle parts, but I'm pretty good judging quality and things breaking apart. I say this seat post will not break down anytime soon, and I get complaints on how it looks. I truly recommend it for people.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer321

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly to bring a marginal seat situation back to life.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a used bike with the seat wobbling on top of a post that CLEARLY was not designed to hold a standard seat. This post fixed that and allowed the bike to become nice enough that someone wanted to buy it. How cool is that?
customer_reviews.author: Barry J.

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: I only just started using this post, but it seems to be exactly what I need: the materials seem good (including the seat holder on top) and it is long enough for me to raise the seat to where I want it. It is not too heavy and not too expensive. I attached a bike rack to the post without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: bwasow

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t fit a standard bike diameter.
customer_reviews.text: Diameter is off and I finally found time to work on my bike to find this out. Of course I’m 8 days pasted the return window so I can’t return it. Really bumbed that this doesn’t fit standard diameter bike shafts.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Strong post,  But get a set of Allen wrenches.  Use the big one.
customer_reviews.text: Strong post that will not bend or break easily. To install, it required I use the bigger Allen Wrench. So it was good I had a whole set of them.
customer_reviews.author: Jayme Swier

customer_reviews.title: Eventually Snapped in Two
customer_reviews.text: No problems with initial installation but eventually broke and gouged my leg. This seat post offers no particular advantage in strength or durability over other brands.
customer_reviews.author: David H. Price

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: It's held up well so far. I did have to cut it down a bit, but I have a very short seat tube, so I expected to do that anyway.
customer_reviews.author: J.Schooler

customer_reviews.title: Solid post
customer_reviews.text: Decent post. But be sure to double check that you’ve selected the right size. I accidentally ordered too small twice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rugged, light weight.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid light weight seat post. I wish it would allow more forward tilt, as my bike has a strong back angle on its seat post receiver.
customer_reviews.author: John A Nees

customer_reviews.title: Post doesn't like usable saddle angles
customer_reviews.text: If you adjust your saddle angle to anything that's actually rideable, the post will loosen itself up within 5 minutes and basically become a bobblehead. The only way to keep it put is to angle the seat so far back that the front of the saddle will be stabbing you. After many months I've never had a ride where this post wasn't a problem for me.
customer_reviews.author: David Strand

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old one cause it was stuck. This one fit right in. 25.4
customer_reviews.author: UPSmanjoe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: It fit perfectly and was very easy to install if you know how.
customer_reviews.author: Saida Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Cannot unscrew the bolt.
customer_reviews.text: Impossible to unscrew the bolt to attach it. Gave up and threw it out. Under no circumstances but this item.
customer_reviews.author: John Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a custom cruiser project. Fits good. Looks good. I will not hesitate to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Buzyrd

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS BETTER QUALITY AND WORKED PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.text: I USED ON A KENT KX-7 32" BIKE. I AM 6'6" AND NEEDED ABOUT 1 INCH MORE THAN ORIGINAL EQUIPMENT. THIS IS BETTER QUALITY AND WORKED PERFECTLY
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: I'd pass on this seatpost.
customer_reviews.text: Gave 3 stars because I can't get my saddle level. Plus it says "CANSUCC" on it. Haha! I mean, come on?!?!? Lol!!!
customer_reviews.author: Allan VW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent part. Exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Post works better than expected. The machined texture and etched markings add clamping and adjusting utility. I also like the micro-adjustability of the seat clamp, and the component's structural integrity.
customer_reviews.author: george tatum

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Why are there easy so many different sizes? Mic your post to get the corect size.
customer_reviews.author: William T.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for raising bike seat. I'm 205# & it's sturdy enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Bevy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good product, easy to deal with right on time AAA+++++
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Product was a little trick getting g the seat attached but it works well
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Montalto

customer_reviews.title: Cysky bike seat post 30.4
customer_reviews.text: It seems nice but it won't fit my schwinn boundary . 🙁
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Does not come with an Allen key - is a non-standard (large) size.
customer_reviews.text: Came without an Allen wrench and does not use a standard size, so I am unable to unscrew it to attach my seat. Would not have bought if I had known it was non-standard size/didn’t come with the proper sized Allen key
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: buy a collar
customer_reviews.text: I liked the post but had to return it because the diameter was 3/32 less than advertised. An inch is not always an inch. 25.4 mm
customer_reviews.author: Jaqueline Rutkowitz

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size bad quality control on size
customer_reviews.text: Size is not correct should be 27.2 measures 27.0 doesn't work
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: All good
customer_reviews.text: Ya know, it's a seat post. Diameter fit perfectly, no worry's. The only trouble is how far you want to tilt, if using it for a BMX bike it doesn't have as much tilt as needed, but fine for any other application
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Lack of adjustment.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it tilted the nose of the seat up more
customer_reviews.author: Iowa bikeguy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product - easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product - easy to fit the saddle and install in the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Wood

customer_reviews.title: Installed easy and the settings were well marked
customer_reviews.text: No issues. Installed easy and the settings were well marked. Plenty of length for my daughter's height of 5' 8". Compatible with the Daway seat I purchased just needed to take the top clip off for it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Martini

customer_reviews.title: Seems well built.
customer_reviews.text: Had to cut it down for my bike but after that it seemed to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Once I put the sleeve in it worked fine.
customer_reviews.text: It was too small so I had to buy a sleeve to take up the space. Once I put the sleeve in it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: TJS

customer_reviews.title: Works great and airily priced
customer_reviews.text: Works great and is reasonable priced. I used this to replace the spring post on my comfort bike.
customer_reviews.author: craig smith

customer_reviews.title: Replacement road bike seat post.
customer_reviews.text: A little bit heavier than carbon, but a lot of value here at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Ankenbrand

customer_reviews.title: This seatpost is aluminum and pretty solid, I have used it to replace older ...
customer_reviews.text: This seatpost is aluminum and pretty solid, I have used it to replace older clamp style posts on several bikes.
customer_reviews.author: McNugget Commander

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - does what a seatpost should do
customer_reviews.text: It fits correctly and has decent paint. No complaints whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Brenden D Richard

customer_reviews.title: It works like it is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. It is well made, including the clamp.
customer_reviews.author: David A Barker

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had 2 bolts, instead of just one.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Caplan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nicely Made, Lite Weight Aluminum Construction, Much Adjustment, Priced Right
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good seatpost
customer_reviews.text: Needed a seat post for a bike I got for a child. This fit perfectly. Nice price.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great price and perfect for my men's diamond bike mountain bike
customer_reviews.author: paul murphy

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to make seat level.
customer_reviews.text: You'd expect a seat post to let you adjust the seat from slightly below level (front pointing down) to slightly above level. This post adjusts the seat on my Cannondale MTB from about 40 degrees down to about 10 degrees down. It is impossible to get it level.
customer_reviews.author: Ken D.

customer_reviews.title: Great until It Broke
customer_reviews.text: It was great until it broke while I was riding! I'm not a hard rider, although in the interest of full disclosure, I weigh in at 250 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Received on time; no problems at all. Product works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jim U.

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as intended. Was impressed with the high quality of the item.
customer_reviews.author: Betty Velonis

customer_reviews.title: Go buy a wrench too!
customer_reviews.text: This requires a unique 8mm allen wrench - much bigger than the ones you get with every other allen-wrench-requiring item. I have many of those lying around, but not this size, and they didn't bother to include one despite it being the only way to install the post. If you don't keep an 8mm around, then it's a trip to Lowe's where you need to buy a $4.89 set to get the 8mm.
customer_reviews.author: B.E. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Post fits great but how do you attach the seat to it?
customer_reviews.author: Brian Albrecht

customer_reviews.title: It fits!
customer_reviews.text: Has everything I needed to attach my new seat. fits nice. The measurements on the post are great for adjustments and remembering the last height adjustment.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine and has handy measurement marks on it. Make sure you get the right diameter as they are not all the same.
customer_reviews.author: buttersh

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be great quality. Used with Sunlite Cloud-9 Bicycle Suspension Cruiser Saddle (though I had to adjust the connection on the seat).
customer_reviews.author: Angela & Bobby

product_meta.title: CYSKY 25.4/27.2/28.6/30.4/30.8/31.6 SeatPost 350mm Bike Seat Post Suitable for Most Bicycle Mountain Bike Road Bike MTB MTN BMX (Aluminum Alloy, Black)
product_meta.description:
Note: Please choose the right size of the seatpost


Specification:
Size: 25.4/27.2/28.6/30.4/30.8/31.6 × 350mm
Diameter: 25.4/27.2/28.6/30.4/30.8/31.6mm
Total length: 350mm (13.7inch), Tube Length: 325mm (12.8inch), Head Length: 25mm (0.9inch)
Strength: 4.9 levels ultra high strength, maxium of 580lbs
Setback: 20mm
Adjust tube length: 0-320mm
Use: mountain bike, track bike, fixed gear, road bike and so on 

Package Include:
1 * Bike Seatpost

FAQ:
Q: what is diameter of this seat post? 
A: 25.4/27.2/28.6/30.4/30.8/31.6mm

Q: How much is the setback of this seat post? 
A: 20mm

Q: Does this come with the seat clamp? 
A: Yes

Q: Is it possible to adjust the seat angle with this seatpost? 
A: Yes. The top bracket is adjustable so you can slide the seat trails forward and backward as well as adjust the tilt of the seat.

Q: How to determine which seat post will fit my bike? 
A: Measure your post with calipers for diameter, Measure your old seat post length, select your new seat post length. If you don't have measure tool, you could measure the outside diameter of the seat tube with a ruler, and caculate the diameter of your old post.

ADD The Bike Seat Post to Your Cart, Enjoy The Rides
feature_bullets: Size: 25.4 × 350mm (apx 305g/pc), Total length: 350mm, Tube Length: 325mm, Head Length: 25mm.Strength: 4.9 levels ultra high strength, maxium of 580lbs ; Setback: 20mm. Adjust tube length of 0 to 320mm
How to Choose the Size:1.Check the diameter of the original seatpost,choose the same size as the original diameter.2.Measure the inside diameter of the frame tube.
Constructed of ultra light and strong 6061 T6 aluminum alloy. Light weight, never rust
Suitable for most road bike, fixed gear bicycle, mountain bikes, downhill bike, track bike, MTB, BMX, DH, etc
With adjustable head, Easy to install. Frosting finish, exquisite workmanship, nice touch feeling
